name: Mitigation Playbook for Malicious PowerShell Execution
description: This playbook addresses an incident where an attacker utilized a PowerShell script to execute malicious commands and manipulate system files.

action--b5225efc-f460-4f4f-b929-e2c82f02.name: Kill Malicious PowerShell Process
action--b5225efc-f460-4f4f-b929-e2c82f02.description: Terminate the PowerShell process exploiting the system.

parallel--c315bd59-764e-4229-9bb3-de006b.name: Simultaneous Mitigation Steps
parallel--c315bd59-764e-4229-9bb3-de006b.description: Execute network and file restoration mitigations concurrently.

action--2e309856-91dc-41b8-8160-0bc1e3f8.name: Block Network Connection
action--2e309856-91dc-41b8-8160-0bc1e3f8.description: Block the known malicious IP address to stop further exploitation.

loop--9abb6571-9bec-4c70-a2b5-8e102a97e7.name: Scan and Restore Modified Files
loop--9abb6571-9bec-4c70-a2b5-8e102a97e7.description: Iteratively scan and restore modified configuration files.

action--9abb6571-9bec-4c70-a2b5-8e102a97.name: Restore Files
action--9abb6571-9bec-4c70-a2b5-8e102a97.description: Restore each modified configuration file that has been detected.

commands.command: for file in /path/to/config/files/*; do restore_file $file; done
